entries.source: Chat Edit: 'Yes, let's create visual notification popups and also implement persistence across restarts, reloads, reboots, etc.'
Chat Edit: 'Yes, let's create visual notification popups and also implement persistence across restarts, reloads, reboots, etc.'
Chat Edit: 'For some reason, I cannot click on any of the Allow buttons.'
Chat Edit: 'For some reason, I cannot click on any of the Allow buttons.'
Chat Edit: 'The test notification "bubbles" are getting cut off on the left side. Can you look into this? '

Chat Edit: 'I can't launch quickshell:

archlinux%  ERROR: Failed to load configuration
 ERROR:   caused by @shell.qml[333:25]: Cannot assign to non-existent property "onCloseRequested"

[1]  + 168652 exit 255   quickshell'
Chat Edit: 'The close and clear all buttons are working again, but the notifications are still a bit malformed. '
Chat Edit: 'There are still no popup notifications visible when testing. It does appeat that everything else is working now, however!'
Chat Edit: 'There are still no popup notifications visible when testing. It does appeat that everything else is working now, however!'

Chat Edit: 'The popups display beautifully, and appear in the notification center, but once they time out on the screen and slide away, they also disappear from the notification center without manuually dismissing them. Can you make them persistent in notification center until clicking the close button or clear all?'

Chat Edit: 'The popups display beautifully, and appear in the notification center, but once they time out on the screen and slide away, they also disappear from the notification center without manuually dismissing them. Can you make them persistent in notification center until clicking the close button or clear all?'

Chat Edit: 'The popups display beautifully, and appear in the notification center, but once they time out on the screen and slide away, they also disappear from the notification center without manuually dismissing them. Can you make them persistent in notification center until clicking the close button or clear all?'

Chat Edit: 'The popups display beautifully, and appear in the notification center, but once they time out on the screen and slide away, they also disappear from the notification center without manuually dismissing them. Can you make them persistent in notification center until clicking the close button or clear all?'

Chat Edit: 'That seems to have helped, thank you!

One other item that needs addressed--the notification popup is often too small for verbose notifications, such that the text runs off the right side of the popup border. Can we wrap the text if it doesn't fit on one line without messing some things up?

I also noticed that when there are notifications in the notification center, some items in the upper right side of the screen will not be clickable, presumably because there is some kind of transparent window over the browser window.

'
Chat Edit: 'The notification popup issue appears to still be an issue. Here is a screenshot to illustrate the runoff on the notification popup title: '
Chat Edit: 'The notification popup title is still overrunning the right border of the popup.'

Chat Edit: 'I have a custom shell with a custom notification service that I need help with. I'm having an issue with the notification popup titles running off the right side of the popup in the main desktop wndow. This does not happen to the notifications listed in the notification center. '
Chat Edit: 'Unfortunately, this did not work. '
Chat Edit: 'Unfortunately, this did not resolve the issue.'
Chat Edit: 'Unfortunately, this did not resolve the issue.'

Chat Edit: 'Still no luck. This is mainly happening when the notification pops up after taking a screenshot which has a long pathname in the title, which is still running off the right side of the notification popup window. It runs beyond the margin of the notification window inside the notification center container, too, but doesn't look as bad as the desktop popup. (screenshot)
'

Chat Edit: 'Still no luck. This is mainly happening when the notification pops up after taking a screenshot which has a long pathname in the title, which is still running off the right side of the notification popup window. It runs beyond the margin of the notification window inside the notification center container, too, but doesn't look as bad as the desktop popup. (screenshot)
'
